intro: Aeschynomene bella, commonly known as the smallleaf aeschynomene, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. It has a fibrous root system and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Aeschynomene bella is sometimes used in traditional medicine and as a forage plant for livestock.
